<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/26/johnson-johnson-ordered-pay-historic-trial?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Johnson & Johnson Gets Mixed Messages in Historic Trial
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Johnson & Johnson Gets Mixed Messages in Historic Trial" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2ODU0NjQyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, an Oklahoma judge ruled that drugmaker Johnson & Johnson <a href="https://www.axios.com/johnson-johnson-opioids-lawsuit-oklahoma-verdict-064cf614-2d05-45c5-833b-88bb9a9d40bd.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">must pay</a> $572 million to the state for its role in the opioid crisis that killed more than 47,000 Americans in 2017 alone.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The details</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What Oklahoma said: </strong></span><span>State Attorney General Mike Hunter argued that Janssen, J&J's pharmaceutical subsidiary, created a “</span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/08/26/754347718/oklahoma-judge-to-rule-in-landmark-opioid-case?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">public nuisance</a></span><span>” by misinforming both doctors and the public about the addictive risks of painkillers as early as the 1990s. The state called J&J the “kingpin” of the crisis. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What J&J said: </strong></span><span>It lawfully marketed and sold prescription opioid painkillers, and its products account for </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/oklahoma-opioid-trial-decision-expected-landmark-case-against-johnson-and-johnson-janssen-today-2019-08-26/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under 1%</a></span><span> of the Oklahoma opioid market (a stat the state disputed). It’s appealing the decision.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">J&J could have made out much worse. Oklahoma was seeking over $17 billion, while investors penciled in a fine of up to $5 billion, per Evercore. J&J shares <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-26/j-j-losses-oklahoma-opioid-trial-must-pay-572-million?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> after hours given the lighter-than-expected fine. But still…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/6BHo4gLh9rqtW/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Giphy </em></sup></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what comes next?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The seven-week trial was <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/26/judge-rules-against-johnson-johnson-in-landmark-opioid-case-in-oklahoma.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the first</a> by a state seeking compensation for an opioid-driven public health crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And the entire industry was nervously watching. Oklahoma’s decision to hold a pharmaceutical company accountable for contributing to the opioid crisis could set a precedent for the roughly 1,900 pending cases against J&J, Purdue, Teva, and other prominent drugmakers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some experts have </span><span><a href="https://time.com/5662105/johnson-johnson-stock-jumps-opioid-ruling/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suggested</a></span><span> opioid producers could have to pay up to $100 billion to resolve their liability for the opioid crisis.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Food for thought:</strong> The “public nuisance” argument Oklahoma used is traditionally wielded in property disputes, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/johnson-johnson-ordered-to-pay-572-million-in-oklahoma-opioid-case-11566850079?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ reports</a>. But it was also used successfully to fight Big Tobacco in the 1990s, resulting in a <a href="https://www.insurancejournal.com/news/national/2019/05/27/527539.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$246 billion settlement</a> in 1998.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/26/kraft-brings-back-old-cfo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kraft's Out With the New, in With the Old
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On September 1, Paulo Basilio, Kraft Heinz’s CFO from 2015 to 2017, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/26/kraft-heinz-says-paulo-basilio-to-return-as-cfo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will return</a> to the company and replace its current CFO, David Knopf. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Knopf became the youngest CFO of a Fortune 500 company when he took the Kraft Heinz (+0.99%) job at 29. Now 31, Knopf loves going to bed at 10pm on the weekends and will return to 3G Capital, the PE firm that merged Kraft and Heinz in 2015.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New blood doesn’t always do the trick. </strong>During both Basilio’s and Knopf’s tenures, Kraft Heinz has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-kraft-heinz-cfo/kraft-heinz-brings-back-former-cfo-after-accounting-missteps-idUSKCN1VG19X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been plagued</a> by weak sales and accounting errors. <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kraft-heinz-replaces-finance-chief-11566824303?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Per the WSJ</a>, it has...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Restated financial earnings dating back to 2016 after flubbing certain costs by $208 million.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Marked down the value of its brands by close to $17 billion this year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reported a 5% annual decrease in net sales for the first half of 2019.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Facing growing private label competition and shrinking demand for purple ketchup, Kraft Heinz will face challenges charting the “new course” CEO Miguel Patricio has planned.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/26/indonesia-moves-capital-avoid-another-atlantis?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Indonesia Moves Capital to Avoid Another Atlantis
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Indonesia Moves Capital to Avoid Another Atlantis" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2ODUxMzE1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/iqbalnuril-12845379/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=4293097" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">iqbal nuril anwar</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=4293097" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He’s not buying Greenland, but Indonesian President Joko Widodo did <a href="https://www.scmp.com/news/asia/southeast-asia/article/3024352/indonesia-announces-site-new-capital-city-reduce-jakartas?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announce</a> Monday he’s relocating the nation’s capital from Jakarta to the island of Borneo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why Jakarta's out: </strong>The roughly 30 million people living in the area contribute to excessive pollution and traffic (gridlock <span>and public transport issues cost</span> Jakarta $7 billion a year). Plus, <span>parts of the city are sinking over seven</span> inches annually. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Jakarta's environmental issues are largely its own doing. The city has polluted water resources and pulled out so much groundwater the land is sinking, NPR </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/08/26/754291131/indonesia-plans-to-move-capital-to-borneo-from-jakarta?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Widodo wants to spread the wealth </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Generating nearly 20% of Indonesia’s annual GDP, the Jakarta metro area is hogging the economic spotlight. The new capital will sit across largely undeveloped areas in Borneo’s East Kalimantan province.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Done right,</strong></span><span> Indonesia could create a greener, more modern, smart-city successor to Jakarta and bring infrastructure and economic activity to Borneo. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Done wrong, </strong></span><span>Indonesia could find itself spending up to $32.8 billion on a new city only to repeat the same environmental mistakes. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new capital doesn’t have a name yet, but one definitely comes to mind: Albany. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/26/ubs-lobster-exports-feel-trade-war-effects?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Explain to an Alien We're in a Trade War
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When a journalist from the next galaxy over rings your doorbell and asks, "Could you help my planet understand a few concrete business impacts of a trade war?" here's what you can tell them…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. UBS Global Wealth Management, our planet's largest wealth manager, said it is going "<a href="https://www.ubs.com/global/en/wealth-management/marketnews/home/article.1449781.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">underweight</a>" on equities for the first time since 2012. That means it recommends its customers reduce exposure to stocks relative to other assets. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The reason:</strong></span><span> President Trump's threats of higher tariffs on China last Friday </span><span><a href="https://www.scmp.com/business/markets/article/3024330/citing-political-uncertainty-ubs-shifts-underweight-equity?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased risk</a></span><span> for global markets and the economy. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. U.S. lobster exports to China are in <a href="https://apnews.com/6482bb8522ef427c8dba0d117327f1b2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">freefall</a>, reports the AP. Through June of this year, the U.S. exported less than 2.2 million pounds of lobster to China. It's more than an 80% drop from the roughly 12 million pounds exported over the same period last year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The reason: </strong></span><span>China hit U.S. lobsters with tariffs last summer. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>President Trump <a href="https://www.apnews.com/568961a192964b849529746567b56a85?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> optimistically yesterday, "I think we're going to have a deal." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Some light reading for the UFO ride home </strong>from <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/subscribe/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GZERO Media</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The meatless revolution has breached the castle walls. Today, a KFC store near Atlanta is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/26/kfc-will-test-beyond-meat-plant-based-chicken.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolling out</a> Beyond Meat's plant-based nuggets and boneless wings, all but guaranteeing fried chicken will remain in the news cycle for a second straight week. And Popeyes's social media guy was just catching up on some sleep...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beyond Meat (+5.64%) founder and CEO Ethan Brown said, "My only regret is not being able to see the legendary Colonel himself enjoy this important moment."</p>

</li>

Trial\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Johnson \u0026amp; Johnson Gets Mixed Messages in Historic Trial\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2ODU0NjQyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, an Oklahoma judge ruled that drugmaker Johnson \u0026 Johnson \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/johnson-johnson-opioids-lawsuit-oklahoma-verdict-064cf614-2d05-45c5-833b-88bb9a9d40bd.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emust pay\u003c/a\u003e $572 million to the state for its role in the opioid crisis that killed more than 47,000 Americans in 2017 alone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe details\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat Oklahoma said: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eState Attorney General Mike Hunter argued that Janssen, J\u0026J's pharmaceutical subsidiary, created a “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/08/26/754347718/oklahoma-judge-to-rule-in-landmark-opioid-case?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epublic nuisance\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” by misinforming both doctors and the public about the addictive risks of painkillers as early as the 1990s. The state called J\u0026J the “kingpin” of the crisis. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat J\u0026J said: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt lawfully marketed and sold prescription opioid painkillers, and its products account for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/oklahoma-opioid-trial-decision-expected-landmark-case-against-johnson-and-johnson-janssen-today-2019-08-26/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunder 1%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of the Oklahoma opioid market (a stat the state disputed). It’s appealing the decision.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJ\u0026J could have made out much worse. Oklahoma was seeking over $17 billion, while investors penciled in a fine of up to $5 billion, per Evercore. J\u0026J shares \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-26/j-j-losses-oklahoma-opioid-trial-must-pay-572-million?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e after hours given the lighter-than-expected fine. But still…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/6BHo4gLh9rqtW/giphy.gif\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what comes next?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe seven-week trial was \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/26/judge-rules-against-johnson-johnson-in-landmark-opioid-case-in-oklahoma.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe first\u003c/a\u003e by a state seeking compensation for an opioid-driven public health crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd the entire industry was nervously watching. Oklahoma’s decision to hold a pharmaceutical company accountable for contributing to the opioid crisis could set a precedent for the roughly 1,900 pending cases against J\u0026J, Purdue, Teva, and other prominent drugmakers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome experts have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://time.com/5662105/johnson-johnson-stock-jumps-opioid-ruling/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuggested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e opioid producers could have to pay up to $100 billion to resolve their liability for the opioid crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFood for thought:\u003c/strong\u003e The “public nuisance” argument Oklahoma used is traditionally wielded in property disputes, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/johnson-johnson-ordered-to-pay-572-million-in-oklahoma-opioid-case-11566850079?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWSJ reports\u003c/a\u003e. But it was also used successfully to fight Big Tobacco in the 1990s, resulting in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.insurancejournal.com/news/national/2019/05/27/527539.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$246 billion settlement\u003c/a\u003e in 1998.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- href=\"https://pixabay.com/users/iqbalnuril-12845379/?utm_source=link-attribution\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_campaign=image\u0026utm_content=4293097\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px but Indonesian President Joko Widodo did \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/news/asia/southeast-asia/article/3024352/indonesia-announces-site-new-capital-city-reduce-jakartas?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounce\u003c/a\u003e Monday he’s relocating the nation’s capital from Jakarta to the island of Borneo. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy Jakarta's out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe roughly 30 million people living in the area contribute to excessive pollution and traffic (gridlock \u003cspan\u003eand public transport issues cost\u003c/span\u003e Jakarta $7 billion a year). Plus, \u003cspan\u003eparts of the city are sinking over seven\u003c/span\u003e inches annually. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJakarta's environmental issues are largely its own doing. The city has polluted water resources and pulled out so much groundwater the land is sinking, NPR \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/08/26/754291131/indonesia-plans-to-move-capital-to-borneo-from-jakarta?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWidodo wants to spread the wealth \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGenerating nearly 20% of Indonesia’s annual GDP, the Jakarta metro area is hogging the economic spotlight. The new capital will sit across largely undeveloped areas in Borneo’s East Kalimantan province.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDone right,\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Indonesia could create a greener, more modern, smart-city successor to Jakarta and bring infrastructure and economic activity to Borneo. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDone wrong, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIndonesia could find itself spending up to $32.8 billion on a new city only to repeat the same environmental mistakes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new capital doesn’t have a name yet, but one definitely UBS Global Wealth Management, our planet's largest wealth manager, said it is going \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.ubs.com/global/en/wealth-management/marketnews/home/article.1449781.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunderweight\u003c/a\u003e\" on equities for the first time since 2012. That means it recommends its customers reduce exposure to stocks relative to other assets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reason:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e President Trump's threats of higher tariffs on China last Friday \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/business/markets/article/3024330/citing-political-uncertainty-ubs-shifts-underweight-equity?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased risk\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for global markets and the economy. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. U.S. lobster exports to China are in \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/6482bb8522ef427c8dba0d117327f1b2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efreefall\u003c/a\u003e, reports the AP. Through June of this year, the U.S. exported less than 2.2 million pounds of lobster to China. It's more than an 80% drop from the roughly 12 million pounds exported over the same period last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli
